From: Elliotte Harold <elharo@...>
Subject: Re: [junit] failSame,. etc. will be public?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=eHVLEzlcSfPZZMbhkbLcZgOLKfxSG8OUqIjIovKosbFSaokg

Kent Beck wrote:
> Elliotte,
> 
> Thank you for pointing this out. The change was not intentional. I am interested in arguments for making them public, though.
> 

Looking at them, what they do is so trivial I would prefer them not to 
be public, solely on the grounds of simplifying the API. Every method 
that can be eliminated is one less thing to document, one less thing to 
explain, one less thing to stumble over when you're looking for 
something else.

I suspect them becoming public had something to do with the relationship 
between the old junit.framework.Assert and the new org.junit.Assert 
classes. (The former now extends the latter.) I don't know why there are 
two classes here. They don't appear to be substantially different. Could 
we just get rid of the new one. Would anything break? Hmm, looking at I 
was able to remove org.junit.framework.Assert fairly easily. I had to do 
a search for the static imports and replace them with 
junit.framework.Assert. I had to make junit.framework.Assert extend 
Object like it used to. Finally I had to fix one class where 
org.junit.Assert was referenced by its fully package qualified name. 
Nothing broke that wasn't broken before, and a couple of tests that were 
previously broken started passing.

So whatever you do with failSame, etc. I recommend removing 
org.junit.framework.Assert.

--
